Title: News
Article Content: In Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, two couples and a woman were allegedly beaten to death on suspicion of practising witchcraft. Five villagers have been detained and are being interrogated. The incident occurred in Ektal village under Konta police station limits. A similar incident happened recently in Balodabazar-Bhatapara district, where four family members were killed over black magic suspicions. Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted India's unstoppable rise, stating the country is no longer a 'sleeping giant'. Speaking at Ramdeobaba University in Nagpur, he emphasized that education should be seen as a service, not commerce. Dhankhar also noted the removal of corrupt middlemen and praised artificial intelligence as a tool for good governance. The Street is eagerly anticipating the listing of Bajaj Housing Finance, which received a record response to its IPO last week. According to grey market trends and analysts' estimates, the company’s shares are expected to deliver multibagger returns to investors. The current GMP for the stock is approximately Rs 84, reflecting a premium of nearly 120% over the issue price. Domestic benchmark equity indices, Sensex and Nifty50, closed marginally lower on Friday, weighed down by FMCG and energy stocks. However, they recorded their best weekly performance since the end of June, ahead of a likely rate cut by the Federal Reserve. Title: NASA astronauts eager to vote from space in US elections; Sunita Williams terms space her 'happy place'
Article Content: Washington, Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams and her fellow NASA colleague Butch Wilmore, currently stuck on the International Space Station (ISS), expressed their anticipation on Saturday for casting their votes in the 2024 US presidential elections from space. Both astronauts emphasised the significance of fulfilling their civic duty despite being in orbit. Williams mentioned that they had already sent down their requests for ballots, adding, "Looking forward to voting from space, which is pretty cool." Title: Latest News
Article Content: In Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, two couples and a woman were allegedly beaten to death on suspicion of practising witchcraft. Five villagers have been detained and are being interrogated. The incident occurred in Ektal village under Konta police station limits. A similar incident happened recently in Balodabazar-Bhatapara district, where four family members were killed over black magic suspicions. Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted India's unstoppable rise, stating the country is no longer a 'sleeping giant'. Speaking at Ramdeobaba University in Nagpur, he emphasized that education should be seen as a service, not commerce. Dhankhar also noted the removal of corrupt middlemen and praised artificial intelligence as a tool for good governance. If you care about the environment, think twice about using AI. Generative artificial intelligence uses 30 times more energy than a traditional search engine, warns researcher Sasha Luccioni, on a mission to raise awareness about the environmental impact of the hot new technology. "I find it particularly disappointing that generative AI is used to search the Internet,"on the sidelines of the ALL IN artificial intelligence conference, in Montreal. Flagship carrier Air Canada said Sunday it has reached a last-minute tentative deal with its pilots, averting a crippling strike that would have grounded flights and risked devastating the economy. "Air Canada has reached a tentative, four-year collective agreement with the Air Line Pilots Association (ALPA), representing more than 5,200 pilots at Air Canada and Air Canada Rouge," the airline said in a statement. Cathay Cargo, part of Cathay Pacific Airways, is in talks with an Indian airline to use its Hong Kong-based cargo terminal. The facility has a capacity of 2.7 million tonnes annually and aims for net zero carbon emissions by 2050. Cathay Cargo also focuses on sustainability and operational efficiency improvements. In an interview with PTI, Meta India vice president Sandhya Devanathan said India is the leading market for short-form video Reels' watch-time on Instagram. The Facebook and Instagram parent Meta is upbeat about the pace and extent to which Reels has caught on with creators and brands alike. Essar Group's IT arm, Black Box, aims to grow its India business share by 1-2 percentage points as it targets USD 2 billion in revenue by 2027-28. The company plans to leverage its global expertise and expand its workforce in India from 600 to around 1,000 employees. Black Box focuses on sectors like banking, finance, healthcare, technology, and industrial. Every now and then the market goes through phases, where it prefers a certain set of stocks, not based on sector but based on the overall market cap. So, sometimes it is large caps, at other mid-caps. Now this partially happens, due to the flows which are coming to markets. For example, if more flows are coming to mid-cap or multicap schemes there is bound to be out performance in the mid-cap space. When flows for large caps would increase as has been the case in the month of August. they performed better. Now what it does is that it tends to create a sudden surge in mid-cap or the large cap. Similarly when there is an outflow like the kind of one which we saw in March 2024, midcap stocks tend to decline sharply. Essentially, it is the flows which impact the broader matrix of how midcaps behave. Modi 3.0 has completed its first 100 days, achieving several targets set by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The government has cleared projects worth Rs 3 lakh crore, focusing on infrastructure and farming. Initiatives for youth employment, women empowerment, and tribal development have been launched. Efforts in healthcare, security, and cybercrime mitigation have also been highlighted. Arvind Kejriwal announced his resignation as Delhi's Chief Minister, to be effective in two days. He plans to stay out of office until the upcoming elections, urging voters to support him if they believe in his honesty. The Election Commission's decision on early polls remains uncertain. The local meteorological department has issued a 'yellow' alert for thunderstorms and lightning in six districts of Himachal Pradesh on Sunday and Wednesday. Intermittent rains have been recorded, with Kasauli receiving the highest rainfall of 53 mm. Over 40 roads are closed, and 53 power supply schemes disrupted. The state has faced significant losses and casualties during this monsoon season. India needs to boost container production, promote domestic use, strengthen shipping firms, and enhance port infrastructure. High freight costs, container shortages, and reliance on foreign carriers challenge exports. Domestic shipping handles only 5-10% of trade volume, with heavy dependence on Chinese containers making India vulnerable to supply disruptions. Neeraj Chopra, India's top javelin thrower, revealed he fractured his left hand's fourth metacarpal during practice. Despite the injury and ongoing groin issues, he competed in the Diamond League final in Brussels, finishing second with a throw of 87.86 meters. Chopra aims to address his fitness challenges soon. Due to the approaching Typhoon Bebinca, all flights at Shanghai's Pudong and Hongqiao airports will be canceled starting from 8 pm, according to Chinese state media. Maldives Foreign Minister Moosa Zameer has stated that initial misunderstandings with India have been resolved following the repatriation of Indian troops. He emphasized strong ties with both China and India. Zameer also dismissed the need for an IMF bailout, citing temporary economic challenges and ongoing reforms to address fiscal issues. The Maldives continues to strengthen bilateral relations with key allies. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has warned Yemen's Huthi rebels of retaliation after they claimed a missile attack on central Israel. He emphasized that any attempt to harm Israel would incur a heavy price. The warning comes amid ongoing cross-border tensions with Lebanon's Hezbollah and displacement of residents on both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border. The digital economy has opened up numerous opportunities for online side-hustles. Options include online tutoring, freelance writing, affiliate marketing, social media influencing, graphic designing, and stock photography. The project, 'Gaur NYC Residences', has already sold all 1,216 apartments within three days of its launch. The company attributes the strong demand to its credibility and track record in the Delhi-NCR region. Donald Trump's campaign promise to increase tariffs on imports, especially from China, has garnered support from a narrow majority of U.S. voters, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll. The quake not only jolted parts of Pakistan, but it was also felt in north India. Earthquakes are common in Pakistan. The deadliest quake hit the country in 2005, which killed more than 74,000 people. The epicentre of the earthquake was 8 km northwest (NW) of New Delhi, the agency said. The national capital was on Thursday morning struck by a low-intensity earthquake. The National Centre for Seismology recorded the quake to be of 2.8-magnitude.Mild earthquake of 2.8-magnitude hits Delhi ​​​According to National Center for Seismology, earthquake of magnitude 3.5 struck Delhi. Delhi experienced four small earthquakes during April - August 2020, with the first event of magnitude 3.5 on April 12 in the northeastern boundary of Delhi. The earthquake, with its epicentre near Wazirpur in northeast Delhi, occurred at 1.26 pm at a shallow depth of 5 km, said JL Gautam, Head (Operations) at NCS, an institute under the Ministry of Earth Sciences. The tremor measuring 2.2 on the richter scale and at a depth of 8 km hit north-west Delhi according to initial reports. NEW DELHI : A low-intensity earthquake of magnitude 2.1 hit Delhi today, according to the National Centre for Seismology.Delhi hit by another low-intensity earthquake of magnitude 2.1 Delhi-NCR has seen a number of mild earthquakes in the last several weeks. Scientists have warned of a major eathquake in the region. “Recurrent tremors of small magnitudes indicate a bigger earthquake,” said P K Khan, professor of the institute’s applied geophysics department. Delhi-NCR region has witnessed a series of earthquakes since April 12 with one hitting the NCR region just last night with a magnitude of 3.2 on the Richter Scale. Is the big one around the corner? As tremors strike Delhi-NCR, scientists warn of more earthquakes ahead.11 earthquakes since April 12 in Delhi-NCR, is the big one around the corner? The first quake, a medium intensity one of 4.5 magnitude, hit the Haryana city at 9.08 p.m. at a depth of 5 km. The second quake was of lower intensity of magnitude 2.9 and occurred at the same location at 10 p.m., the National Centre for Seismology said. An earthquake measuring 3.5 on the Richter scale was felt in the Delhi-NCR on Sunday evening, according to the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD). The tremors were felt at around 5:45 pm and the epicentre was East Delhi. Further details are awaited.Earthquake of magnitude 3.5 felt in Delhi-NCR, epicentre in East Delhi Lasting a few seconds the earthquake is reported to have originated 44 km southwest of Muzaffarnagar in Uttar Pradesh. The earthquake shook the national capital at around 4.30 am and was epicentred 13 kilometres southeast of Bawal in Haryana. A medium-intensity earthquake measuring 3.0 magnitude on the Richter scale hit the national capital early today. Four earthquakes shook Delhi within a period of 4 hours early today. The first quake measuring 3.1 on Richter scale occurred at 12.41 AM. Sanjauli Mosque Shimla: Protest has occured over an illegal construction on mosque in Sanjauli. A large of protestors including members of some Hindu organizations gathered in the Dhalli area of Shimla on Wednesday and held a protest against the alleged illegal construction of a mosque in the Sanjauli area. The Shimla Municipal Corporation Commissioner's court fixed the next hearing for October 5. To make buildings more resilient to seismic activity, various earthquake-proofing technologies are being used worldwide. These include base isolation systems, dampers, and levitation techniques. Base isolation systems separate the building structure from its foundation, dampers act as shock absorbers, and levitation techniques involve elevating a house off the ground during an earthquake. The National Center for Seismology (NCS) said, "Earthquake of Magnitude:4.1, Occurred on 14-11-2022, 03:42:27 IST, Lat: 31.95 & Long: 73.38, Depth: 120 Km, Location: 145km WNW of Amritsar, Punjab." Several people took to social media to share their experiences. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal also took to social media and wrote: "I hope all of you are safe." The resident welfare associations in the national capital said there were no reports of damage or casualties. Netizens turn to Twitter to share hilarious memes as the tremors of earthquake were felt in Delhi NGO Delhi Study Group, headed by senior BJP leader Vijay Jolly, gathered the relief material over a two-day-long drive in the national capital. High Court also said each government has been extending the date till which illegal constructions are protected from punitive action as it is "looking for votes". The Delhi govt officials while confirming that the CM will make big revelations today, did not mention the topic of the press conference. DMRC today said all its structures are designed according to set guidelines to ensure safety during earthquakes. » Trending Now Hot on Web In Case you missed it Top Calculators Latest News Follow us on:

Title: Economy
Article Content: India needs to boost container production, promote domestic use, strengthen shipping firms, and enhance port infrastructure. High freight costs, container shortages, and reliance on foreign carriers challenge exports. Domestic shipping handles only 5-10% of trade volume, with heavy dependence on Chinese containers making India vulnerable to supply disruptions. The Reserve Bank of India plans to modernise its currency management infrastructure over the next 4-5 years. This includes creating new currency management centres, introducing warehouse automation, and enhancing security systems. The goal is to ensure adequate storage and handling capacity for future cash needs while maintaining efficiency and security. Title: India
Article Content: Kerala Health Minister Veena George confirmed that a man who recently died in Malappuram was infected with Nipah virus. The outbreak in Malappuram has been contained, and restrictions have been lifted after a 42-day double incubation period. All 472 people under observation have been cleared and removed from the contact list. In Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, two couples and a woman were allegedly beaten to death on suspicion of practising witchcraft. Five villagers have been detained and are being interrogated. The incident occurred in Ektal village under Konta police station limits. A similar incident happened recently in Balodabazar-Bhatapara district, where four family members were killed over black magic suspicions. Kasol is renowned as India's best hill station. It's a charming village in the Kullu district, known as the "Amsterdam of India." Here, you may take in Himachal Pradesh's stunning scenery and life-changing experiences to make your journey worthwhile. Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted India's unstoppable rise, stating the country is no longer a 'sleeping giant'. Speaking at Ramdeobaba University in Nagpur, he emphasized that education should be seen as a service, not commerce. Dhankhar also noted the removal of corrupt middlemen and praised artificial intelligence as a tool for good governance. The local meteorological department has issued a 'yellow' alert for thunderstorms and lightning in six districts of Himachal Pradesh on Sunday and Wednesday. Intermittent rains have been recorded, with Kasauli receiving the highest rainfall of 53 mm. Over 40 roads are closed, and 53 power supply schemes disrupted. The state has faced significant losses and casualties during this monsoon season. Maldives Foreign Minister Moosa Zameer has stated that initial misunderstandings with India have been resolved following the repatriation of Indian troops. He emphasized strong ties with both China and India. Zameer also dismissed the need for an IMF bailout, citing temporary economic challenges and ongoing reforms to address fiscal issues. The Maldives continues to strengthen bilateral relations with key allies. Undiscovered beach destination Diu is located close to the Gujarat border. You can obtain some privacy from the frantic crowds that are frequently encountered at well-known beach locations here because there are less people here. In Wayanad district, the usual Onam celebrations have been halted due to the devastating landslides on July 30. The landslides destroyed Mundakkai and Chooralmala, leaving many residents homeless and grieving. The state government has canceled official Onam festivities and is focusing on rebuilding efforts, urging citizens to contribute to the Chief Minister's Distress Relief Fund. Police have booked 50 people, including VHP leaders and former councillors, for violence during a protest demanding the demolition of an illegal mosque portion in Shimla. The protest turned violent with stone-pelting and clashes with police. Authorities are investigating further and have gathered evidence to identify more culprits. Muslim sculptor Salim Sheikh made world's smallest 3 Ganesh idols using a single pencil graphite. He said, “When I saw big idols of Ganesh in Mumbai, I decided to make the smallest idol of Ganesh with the pencil graphite. On this pencil I have been successful in making 3 Ganesh idols. Before this one, four pencils have broken. My message is of communal harmony.”  Former RG Kar Medical College Principal Sandip Ghosh and Tala Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abhijit Mondal were arrested by the CBI in connection with the rape and murder of a Post Graduate trainee. They are accused of misleading the investigation and tampering with evidence. The Supreme Court will hear the case next on Tuesday, while junior doctors continue their protest. Moderate to heavy rain affected parts of south Bengal, including Kolkata, due to a deep depression. The weather system was located near Kolkata and is expected to move westwards, weakening into a depression. Kolkata recorded over 62 mm rainfall, causing waterlogging and slow traffic on major roads. Heavy rain is expected in the next 12 hours. The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana and Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act have significantly improved lives in Dhangri block, Rajouri district. Residents now have 'pucca' houses and frequent employment opportunities, reducing issues like migration and housing repairs. Local officials highlight the success of these schemes in providing tangible benefits to the community. Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar inaugurated 'Constitution Temples' at vocational training centres in 434 Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs) across Maharashtra. The event, held in Mumbai, was organized by the Maharashtra Skill, Employment, Entrepreneurship, and Innovation Department. Maharashtra Governor C P Radhakrishnan and Union Minister Ramdas Athawale attended. Dhankhar also visited Lalbaugcha Raja Ganesh pandal and Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's residence during his two-day visit. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has reported that a deep depression over Gangetic West Bengal and adjoining Bangladesh is expected to weaken into a depression within 24 hours. Heavy rainfall warnings have been issued for Gangetic West Bengal, including Kolkata, as well as Odisha, Jharkhand, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal. Prime Minister Narendra Modi distributed sanction letters to PMAY-G beneficiaries in Tatanagar, Jharkhand, and released the first instalment of Rs 32 crore at Ranchi. Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan highlighted that 2.95 crore houses have been approved under PMAY, with plans for three crore more houses, including two crore in rural areas. Title: Decoded
Article Content: SpiceJet will temporarily furlough 150 cabin crew members for three months due to a lean travel season and reduced fleet size. The airline aims to ensure long-term stability while retaining health benefits and earned leave for these employees. SpiceJet is also under enhanced DGCA surveillance following a special audit conducted in August 2024. Jio AI-Cloud Welcome Offer: Reliance has announced the Jio AI-Cloud Welcome Offer to be launched this Diwali, providing up to 100 GB of free cloud storage for Jio users. The initiative aligns with the vision of 'AI Everywhere For Everyone' and includes features like Jio TvOS, Jio Home IoT, Jio TV+, and Jio Phonecall AI. Mpox virus Updates: A new strain of the mpox virus, clade Ib, has emerged from Congo, evolving quickly and spreading rapidly among humans. Scientists expressed concerns over its transmission patterns and severity, especially due to limited resources in African laboratories. The WHO has declared another health emergency as a result. The nose provides valuable health cues. Persistent congestion, unusual smells, or changes in appearance could signal health issues. Acne vulgaris and rosacea can affect the nose. Sarcoidosis may cause bluish rashes, and trigeminal trophic syndrome can numb the nose. Monitoring these signs can aid early diagnosis and treatment of underlying conditions. Israel news: On Sunday, Hezbollah launched rockets and drones at Israel, escalating tensions in West Asia. This came after the assassination of a Hezbollah commander by Israeli forces. Israel conducted pre-emptive strikes, targeting launch sites in southern Lebanon. Defense measures were heightened, including civil defense instructions and state of emergency declarations. Anil Ambani: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has banned Anil Ambani and 24 related entities from the securities market for five years due to fund diversion at Reliance Home Finance. Ambani faces a Rs 25 crore fine, while Reliance Home Finance faces a six-month ban and Rs 6 lakh penalty. Cyber Dost, under the home ministry, warned about a fraudulent letter claiming to be from the Indian Cybercrime Coordination Centre. The letter falsely accuses recipients of accessing child pornography and threatens legal action within 24 hours. The Times of India received a similar letter. Users are advised to remain calm and report any cyber crime. A US government report revealed a connection between higher fluoride levels in drinking water and lower IQ in children. The National Toxicology Program analyzed global studies and found that fluoride levels over 1.5 milligrams per liter were consistently associated with reduced IQ, raising concerns about the need for further research and policy adjustments. Research by Danube Private University in Austria revealed that drinking water from plastic bottles may elevate blood pressure due to microplastics. Their study in the journal Microplastics found blood pressure decreased significantly when participants consumed fluids not in plastic bottles. The study suggests avoiding plastic-packaged beverages to potentially lower blood pressure. Three students died due to basement flooding at Rau's IAS Study Circle in Old Rajender Nagar. The incident raised concerns about UPSC coaching centers' safety. The Municipal Corporation of Delhi sealed 13 centers' basements, highlighting the need for stricter safety regulations. New guidelines mandate proper infrastructure and safety compliance at coaching centers. Global Capability Centres (GCCs) in India, vital for IT, R&D, and business outsourcing, face rising costs due to geopolitical issues and inflation. AI-powered hyperautomation offers solutions by streamlining operations, empowering employees, and fostering innovation through Centres of Excellence (CoE). This technology enhances efficiency, reduces costs, and ensures business resilience, positioning GCCs for future growth and success. 2024 Budget: This is the first Budget during Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government's third term in office. People of India have reinforced their faith in the government led by Modi and re-elected it for the third term, Nirmala Sitharaman said, while presenting the Budget in Lok Sabha. Microsoft outage: The Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) disrupts Windows users with sudden system shutdowns or restarts. To resolve BSOD errors, identify the error code, update drivers, check for Windows updates, run a memory check, scan for malware, inspect hard drive errors, and uninstall recent software. If issues persist, perform a System Restore or seek professional help to maintain system stability. Thousands of Windows users are facing the Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) error due to a recent CrowdStrike update, affecting companies, banks, and government offices in the US and Australia. The BSOD causes sudden system shutdowns or restarts. Users are advised to remove recent hardware, update Windows, or use the Blue Screen Troubleshooter. Microsoft is working to resolve the issue. Violence in Bangladesh has left at least six dead and hundreds injured as students demand reforms to the quota system governing government jobs. The protests were triggered by the High Court reinstating a 30% job quota for families of 1971 war freedom fighters, which was previously abolished in 2018. The Supreme Court has suspended this order, setting an August 7 hearing.  Karnataka Job Reservation: The Karnataka bill reserves jobs for locals, impacting companies like Google and Intel. Announced by Siddaramaiah, it faces Nasscom's backlash. Enforced by a Nodal Agency, violations fine ₹10,000–₹25,000, with daily fines for persistent breaches. Companies must train or seek exemptions, retaining 25% management, 50% non-management roles. Includes 100% C&D grade reservations and local candidate criteria. Compliance by Assistant Labour Commissioner. Title: 8 traditional South Indian dishes for Ganesh Chaturthi
Article Content: Sep 12, 2024 Made with rice flour, coconut, jaggery, and cardamom filling, these steamed dumplings represent purity and devotion. Image Source: iStock A traditional South Indian delicacy, vermicelli payasam is created with cardamom-infused milk, sugar, and roasted vermicelli.  Image Source: iStock Boiled chickpeas are the base of the flavorful Chana Sundal meal, which is also seasoned with grated coconut, curry leaves, and mustard seeds. Image Source: iStock Rice, tamarind paste, and a variety of spices are combined to make the tangy and flavorful dish known as pulihora, or tamarind rice.  Image Source: iStock A lovely and healthful dessert, beetroot halwa is made by simmering grated beets with ghee, milk, sugar, and cardamom. Image Source: iStock It is a crispy lentil dish made with urad dal.  Image Source: iStock These tasty, bite-sized treats are a major component of the Ganesh Chaturthi offerings in Tamil Nadu and Karnataka. They are loaded with flavour.  Image Source: iStock As a delicious offering to Lord Ganesha on Ganesh Chaturthi, kesari bath is frequently made, signifying wealth and good fortune. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: 8 bhindi recipes one needs to try
Article Content: Sep 13, 2024 Crispy fried bhindi served in a creamy, yoghurt-based sauce overflowing with flavor. Image Source:  iStock If there is one traditional bhindi (okra) dish with North Indian tastes, it is Bhindi Masala. Image Source:  iStock Kurkuri Bhindi is a spicy, flavorful, and extremely crispy meal made from soft okra or ladies' finger, gram flour, spices, and seasonings. Image Source:  iStock Kurkuri Bhindi is a spicy, savory, and exceptionally crispy dish made with soft okra or ladies' finger, gram flour, spices, and seasonings. Image Source:  iStock Beautiful pieces of bhindi fried with very basic spices and a delicious combination of coconut, Bengal gram, and mustard seeds. This comes straight from Andhra Pradesh and is ready in no time. Image Source:  iStock Dahi bhindi is a wonderful and flavorful meal made with sauteed tender cooked okra in a smooth, creamy, delicately spiced, and sour yogurt sauce. Image Source:  iStock This Bhindi Do Pyaza is a simple family recipe with a variety of tastes. It contains a lot of okra sautéed with fragrant onions and herbs, but is mild enough to be kid-friendly and excellent to combine with practically any main meal. Image Source:  iStock This aloo bhindi recipe is a tasty, lightly spicy dry curry with okra, potatoes, and spices in an onion-tomato base. Image Source:  iStock Thanks For Reading! Read Next

Title: 8 best hill stations near Telangana for a scenic escape
Article Content: Sep 13, 2024 Located about 120 km from Visakhapatnam, Araku Valley is known for its coffee plantations, scenic landscapes, and pleasant climate. Image Source: iStock A charming hill station with lush greenery, Matheran offers stunning views and a pleasant climate. The Toy Train ride here is a must-experience. Image Source: iStock Often called the "Queen of Hill Stations," Ooty features beautiful botanical gardens, serene lakes, and pleasant weather year-round. Image Source: iStock Famous for its strawberry farms and panoramic views, Mahabaleshwar is a perfect destination for nature lovers and those seeking relaxation. Image Source: iStock As the only hill station in Madhya Pradesh, Pachmarhi is renowned for its waterfalls, caves, and lush forests, offering a peaceful retreat. Image Source: iStock Known for its stunning landscapes and scenic viewpoints, Kodaikanal is a great place to enjoy nature walks and boating on the pristine lake. Image Source: iStock Renowned for its coffee estates and lush green hills, Chikmagalur offers a tranquil escape with pleasant weather and beautiful landscapes. Image Source: iStock Also known as Kodagu, Coorg is famous for its coffee plantations, spice gardens, and scenic beauty, making it a fantastic destination for nature enthusiasts. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: Are you eating too much sugar? Watch for these 8 symptoms
Article Content: Sep 13, 2024 Experiencing sudden drops in energy and feeling sluggish can indicate high sugar intake, as sugar leads to spikes and crashes in blood glucose levels. Image Source: iStock Craving sweets and sugary foods even after eating them can signal that your body is becoming dependent on high sugar consumption. Image Source: iStock Excessive sugar can lead to weight gain, especially around the abdomen, due to increased calorie intake and insulin resistance. Image Source: iStock High sugar consumption can impact mood, causing irritability, anxiety, and depression due to fluctuating blood sugar levels. Image Source: iStock Problems like acne, premature aging, and other skin conditions can arise from high sugar intake, which promotes inflammation and increases insulin levels. Image Source: iStock Trouble focusing or experiencing brain fog can be a sign of excessive sugar, as it can affect cognitivefunction and mental clarity. Image Source: iStock Frequent cavities and gum disease can be a result of sugar feeding bacteria in the mouth, leading to poor oral health. Image Source: iStock  High sugar intake can disrupt the gut microbiome, leading to bloating, gas, and other digestive issues. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: ​9 ways to use melon seeds for better blood sugar control
Article Content: Sep 13, 2024 Include a small handful of melon seeds in your daily diet. Consistency is key in managing blood sugar levels. Image Source: iStock Soak melon seeds overnight and consume them on an empty stomach. This can improve digestion and nutrient absorption. Image Source: iStock Sprinkle roasted or raw melon seeds on salads for an extra crunch and a boost in nutrients that may help regulate blood sugar. Image Source: iStock Add melon seed powder to baked goods like muffins or bread to enhance their nutritional profile. Image Source: iStock Incorporate melon seeds into stir-fried dishes for added texture and health benefits. Image Source: iStock Roast melon seeds lightly to enhance their flavor and make them easier to digest. Avoid adding salt or sugar. Image Source: iStock Grind melon seeds into a fine powder and add it to smoothies, yogurt, or oatmeal. This helps integrate the seeds into your diet seamlessly. Image Source: iStock Use melon seeds as a healthy snack option. They are a good source of protein and fiber, which can help stabilize blood sugar levels. Image Source: iStock Combine melon seeds with low glycemic index foods to help balance overall blood sugar levels. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: 9 drinks that help burn belly fat fast
Article Content: Sep 14, 2024 Packed with antioxidants, green tea boosts metabolism and helps burn fat, especially around the belly. Image Source: iStock Rich in vitamin C, lemon water aids digestion and helps in detoxifying the body, which can speed up fat loss. Image Source: iStock ACV helps suppress appetite and regulates blood sugar levels, which can reduce fat storage. Image Source: iStock Herbal teas like chamomile and hibiscus help improve digestion, which can aid in reducing bloating and belly fat. Image Source: iStock Soaking fenugreek seeds in water and drinking it in the morning can help control appetite and improve metabolism. Image Source: iStock Ginger has thermogenic properties that increase calorie burning and can help reduce belly fat. Image Source: iStock Natural electrolytes in coconut water boost metabolism and help in losing excess water weight around the belly. Image Source: iStock Low in calories, cucumber and mint-infused water keeps you hydrated and helps flush toxins from the body, aiding fat loss. Image Source: iStock Caffeine in black coffee boosts metabolism and enhances fat-burning processes when consumed before workouts. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: How to find out which oil suits you
Article Content: Sep 14, 2024 ​Identify whether you have oily, dry, combination, or sensitive skin. Different oils work best for different skin types (e.g., jojoba oil for oily skin, argan oil for dry skin). Image Source: iStock Before applying any oil to larger areas, test it on a small patch of skin to ensure you don't have an allergic reaction. Image Source: iStock If you're prone to acne or clogged pores, look for non-comedogenic oils (like rosehip or hemp seed oil) that won’t block your pores. Image Source: iStock For hair care, match the oil to your hair's needs. Lightweight oils like grapeseed are good for fine hair, while thicker oils like coconut suit coarser hair types. Image Source: iStock Oils rich in vitamins and antioxidants, such as vitamin E in olive oil, can nourish your skin and hair and help with anti-aging. Image Source: iStock Cold-pressed oils retain more nutrients than refined oils, making them a healthier option for both skin and hair. Image Source: iStock If you have sensitive skin, opt for gentle oils like chamomile or calendula oil, which are less likely to irritate. Image Source: iStock Different oils serve different purposes—tea tree oil for acne treatment, castor oil for hair growth, or almond oil for moisturizing. Image Source: iStock Begin with single-ingredient oils instead of blends. This helps you identify which specific oil works best for your skin or hair type. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn Mission: Key Facts About the First Private Spacewalk
Article Content: Sep 14, 2024 SpaceX's Polaris Dawn mission marks the first spacewalk by non-professional astronauts. Image Source: Agencies Fintech billionaire Jared Isaacman spearheads the mission, launched from Kennedy Space Center. Image Source: Agencies Consists of Jared Isaacman, pilot Scott "Kidd" Poteet, SpaceX employees Sarah Gillis, and Anna Menon. Image Source: Agencies EVA began at 10:12 GMT with the Dragon spacecraft in an elliptical orbit, ranging from 120 to 430 miles. Image Source: Agencies Focused on testing the flexibility and durability of SpaceX’s new spacesuits, with Isaacman and Gillis participating. Image Source: Agencies Sarah Gillis, a SpaceX engineer, conducted similar tests and reported findings back to Mission Control. Image Source: Agencies This mission adds to SpaceX’s growing list of accomplishments, showcasing its evolution since 2002. Image Source: Agencies Key objective is to test SpaceX’s new spacesuits for future missions. Image Source: Agencies Crew is testing Starlink’s laser-based communication system, critical for future lunar and Martian missions. Image Source: Agencies Experiments aim to enhance human health and study long-duration space travel effects. Image Source: Agencies Thanks For Reading!

Title: 7 health benefits of waking up early in the morning
Article Content: Sep 15, 2024 Those who awaken early tend to have higher energy levels when they get up and these levels progressively decline over the day, whereas those who rise later typically have lower energy levels in the morning but feel a surge in energy in the evening. Image Source: iStock Those that get up early might use this opportunity to make a quick and nutritious breakfast for their family. Image Source: iStock Getting enough sleep contributes to healthy skin. Your skin cells rejuvenate while you sleep, and increased blood flow and collagen aid in repairing UV and environmental damage. Image Source: iStock Getting your exercise in first thing reduces the likelihood that you will skip it later in the day due to work, social obligations, or just plain exhaustion. Image Source: iStock More time spent sipping coffee leisurely, reading the newspaper, or simply taking in the silence can make you feel a little more at ease and ready to face a busy day. Image Source: iStock Because you have unbroken time to yourself in the morning, this is usually the most productive time of day. Any work you undertake will be completed more quickly when you are not distracted. Image Source: iStock Early risers typically go to bed earlier and get longer, higher-quality sleep. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: 7 Indian snacks to make rainy evenings better
Article Content: Sep 15, 2024 For the most flavorful combination of sweet, sour, and spicy notes, samosas are best consumed hot and accompanied by tamarind and mint chutneys. Image Source: iStock With this adaptable recipe, you can turn your favorite veggies—potatoes, onions, cauliflower, or a colorful combination—into crispy, golden morsels. Image Source: iStock This traditional Indian snack is crunchy, fried, and incredibly delicious. It perfectly captures the essence of the rainy season.  Image Source: iStock There's nothing better than savoring a platter of Indian-style noodles topped with the spicier sauces and an abundance of vegetables. Image Source: iStock There's one monsoon snack that's just ideal for sating those desires on wet evenings: pyaaz waala paratha. Image Source: iStock There's one monsoon snack that's just ideal for sating those desires on wet evenings: pyaaz waala paratha. Image Source: iStock Perfect combination of all the flavours.  Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: 8 lung healthy foods for a longer life
Article Content: Sep 15, 2024 Compounds found in the vividly colored roots and greens of the beetroot plant improve lung function. Image Source: iStock Turmeric's strong anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties make it a popular tool for promoting general health. Turmeric's primary active ingredient, curcumin, may be particularly helpful for promoting lung function. Image Source: iStock Apples have been shown to slow down lung aging and even lessen smoking-related lung damage because they contain the antioxidant quercetin. Image Source: iStock Lentils are a great source of magnesium, iron, copper, and potassium, among other elements that improve lung function. Image Source: iStock Carotenoids, which are abundant in pumpkins, are linked to improved lung function. Image Source: iStock One of the best foods for high levels of vitamin C is peppers. This nutrient is soluble in water and functions as a potent antioxidant in your body. For individuals who smoke, it's extremely crucial to consume adequate vitamin C. Image Source: iStock ​Cocoa and its derivatives, such as dark chocolate, are rich in antioxidants called flavonoids and include theobromine, which helps to relax the airways in the lungs. ​ Image Source: iStock One of the best vegetable sources of lycopene, a carotenoid linked to better lung function, is tomatoes.  Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: 7 yoga asanas to manage your cardiac health
Article Content: Sep 15, 2024 Enhances calmness and relaxation, increases blood circulation, aids with digestion, and relieves tension and anxiety. Image Source: iStock Enhances calmness and relaxation, increases blood circulation, aids with digestion, and relieves tension and anxiety. Image Source: iStock It is advised to perform Utkatasana to increase breathing rate, which would enhance heart health. One of the most heart-opening yoga stances is this one.​ Image Source: iStock The perfect yoga pose that calls for flexibility is uttanasana. It is a soothing stance that helps the person feel calmer.  Image Source: iStock Enhance alignment and posture, increase blood flow, and promote heart health. Image Source: iStock Boost heart health and functioning, increase endurance, and enhance neuromuscular coordination. Image Source: iStock Adho Mukho Svanasana promotes equilibrium and has relaxing properties. It targets your knees and shoulders. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: 7 dal based high protein- dishes for breakfast
Article Content: Sep 15, 2024 Urad dal appe is a tasty dish from the incredibly adaptable South Indian cuisine that pairs well with coconut chutney and dal sambar.  Image Source: iStock Pesarattu, in contrast to the traditional dosa, is prepared with moong dal instead of urad dal. Image Source: iStock A green moong salad is a great option for people who would rather have a lighter meal as part of a nice, healthful breakfast diet for weight loss. Image Source: iStock A well-liked Gujarati meal that is both wonderfully healthful and pleasantly soft is chana dal dhokla. Image Source: iStock When it comes to enjoying a hearty breakfast, parathas are a crowd favorite. Image Source: iStock A satisfying and high-protein way to start the day is with this moonglet, also known as a "moong dal omelette." Image Source: iStock Cheela is an ideal breakfast choice that takes only fifteen minutes to prepare. Image Source: iStock Thanks For Reading!

Title: Nitin Gadkari reveals he was offered PM post: 'We will support you if you become Prime Minister…'
Article Content: On September 14, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said a political leader once offered to support him if he were to enter the race for the Prime Minister's post, but he declined the offer, stating that he did not nurse that ambition.In his speech, Gadkari underlined the importance of ethics in both journalism and politics. “I remember one incident — I would not name anyone — that person said “if you are going to become Prime Minister, we will support you,” Mr. Gadkari said at a journalism awards function, without specifying when the conversation took place. "But, I asked why you should support me, and why should I take your support. To become the Prime Minister is not the aim in my life. I am loyal to my conviction and my organisation, and I am not going to compromise for any post because my conviction is foremost for me," the senior BJP leader added. Title: 'Will resign from the post of Chief Minister in two days': Arvind Kejriwal
Article Content: Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday announced that he will resign from his post as the Chief Minister of Delhi after 2 days and will only come back after winning people's trust. The Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor also demanded early elections in the capital. "(The Supreme) Court has done what it could by ruling in my favour and granting me bail. Today, I come to the people's court to ask you whether you consider Kejriwal guilty or honest. In two days, I will resign from the CM's position, and I won’t sit in that chair until the people decide," he said while addressing his party workers in Delhi. Arvind Kejriwal said he wants to give 'agnipariksha' after coming out of jail. Kejriwal also demanded for early elections in Delhi. "Delhi elections due in February but I demand elections in the national capital be held in November with Maharashtra," he said. Title: International
Article Content: Due to the approaching Typhoon Bebinca, all flights at Shanghai's Pudong and Hongqiao airports will be canceled starting from 8 pm, according to Chinese state media. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has warned Yemen's Huthi rebels of retaliation after they claimed a missile attack on central Israel. He emphasized that any attempt to harm Israel would incur a heavy price. The warning comes amid ongoing cross-border tensions with Lebanon's Hezbollah and displacement of residents on both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border. Title: Cryptocurrency
Article Content: As the cryptocurrency market evolves, investors are exploring underrated tokens beyond Bitcoin and Ethereum. Anush Jafer from Mudrex highlighted 10 promising cryptocurrencies during an ETMarkets live stream, emphasizing the value of diversifying across small-cap, mid-cap, and large-cap tokens for a resilient portfolio. On Friday, blue-chip cryptocurrencies Bitcoin and Ethereum fell as investors anticipated a critical U.S. jobs report that could impact the Federal Reserve’s decision on interest rate cuts. On September 5, the cryptocurrency market experienced a modest rebound, with Bitcoin and Ethereum gaining 1.2% and 1.3%, respectively. Other major coins like Solana and Dogecoin also saw notable increases. Despite the recovery, the Fear & Greed index fell to 34, signaling cautious market sentiment. Bitcoin is currently priced below $57,000, indicating a period of consolidation before any significant upward movement. However, there's optimism for the near future as the October-December quarter historically favors Bitcoin's performance. If you have available funds, consider gradually investing in promising assets to take advantage of potential gains. Bitcoin and Ether fell up to 5% due to U.S. economic slowdown fears and weak ISM manufacturing data. The global crypto market cap dropped below $2 trillion.  In an ETMarkets live stream with Delta Exchange, Saketh Ramakrishna explained the Iron Condor strategy for managing risk in volatile cryptocurrency markets. This non-directional strategy profits from low volatility and was illustrated with a real-world case study showing its practical application and benefits. At 1:54 pm IST, Bitcoin was trading at $58,027, a decrease of nearly 0.5%, while Ethereum had slipped by 0.9% to $2,461. The past week has been challenging for Bitcoin, with a drop of nearly 9%, following a 10% decline in August after briefly reaching $64,000 earlier that month. Edul Patel, Mudrex CEO, attributed Bitcoin's dip below $60,000 to increased selling pressure and outflows from Bitcoin spot ETFs. He warned that if this trend continues, Bitcoin could fall to the $55,700 support level. The U.S. faces pivotal events with the September FOMC meeting and November elections, influencing traditional and crypto markets. Bitcoin's highs and new ETFs signal mainstream acceptance, while Gen Z and Millennials push for crypto-friendly policies, impacting election dynamics and regulatory focus. Major cryptocurrencies declined on Friday, with Bitcoin below $59,500 and altcoins like XRP and Solana dropping. The global market cap fell 1% to $2.08 trillion amid regulatory and earnings concerns. VeChain (VET), a blockchain platform focusing on supply chain management, shows strong growth potential. With robust fundamentals, industry partnerships, and expanding market integration, VET's price has bullish projections from $0.03 to $0.50 by 2030. Continued adoption and innovations are key drivers for VeChain’s future success. Cryptocurrencies rose on Thursday ahead of key U.S. GDP and job data. Bitcoin gained nearly 1% to $59,724, while Ethereum rose 3.6% to $2,557. Market cap increased to $2.1 trillion. Shivam Thakral, CEO of BuyUcoin, explained, "Bitcoin’s drop below $60,000 and Ethereum's nearly 7% fall were driven by a wave of liquidations totaling over $300 million. This was sparked by investor uncertainty and a general market downturn. Despite this setback, the long-term outlook remains positive due to strong fundamentals and ongoing institutional interest." Nasdaq is awaiting regulatory approval to launch and trade options on a bitcoin index. This move would provide institutional investors and traders an alternative way to hedge their exposure to bitcoin. The options would track the CME CF Bitcoin Real-Time Index, supplementing the recently launched leveraged ETFs tied to bitcoin. Stablecoins currently dominate the crypto market, accounting for a significant 92.98% of the total 24-hour trading volume at $61.7 billion. Bitcoin, despite a market cap dip to $1.242 trillion, still holds a 56.26% dominance. Its trading volume surged by 43.6% to $28.15 billion in the last 24 hours. Crypto expert Saketh Ramakrishna discussed the Iron Condor strategy on ETMarkets, highlighting its effectiveness in managing Bitcoin's volatility and comparing it to traditional market strategies. Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) saw slight declines to $63,650 and $2,730, respectively, after nearing $65,000 and $2,900 over the weekend. This shift followed comments from U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on potential rate cuts.  After a periodic scare, the global markets have adopted an upward momentum, showcasing signs of recovery from previous lows. However, while other markets (equity for example) show resilience based on the expectation of a Federal rate cut, the crypto market is yet to register a prolonged upward boom.  Web3's early solution to scalability issues was modularity—breaking down blockchain tasks into separate components. This resulted in the creation of various layer-2 solutions, rollups, sidechains, and state channels, which boosted scalability but also caused increased fragmentation. Each new solution formed its own ecosystem with separate liquidity pools, user bases, and a steeper learning curve for developers and users. UPI, on the other hand, is gaining currency by the day. The UPI transactions hit Rs 20.64 lakh crore in the month of July growing by 35% year-on year. It's the third straight month of Rs 20 lakh crore worth of transactions. Major cryptocurrencies rose on Friday ahead of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's Jackson Hole speech. Bitcoin and Ethereum gained 0.55% and 1.5%, respectively. Traders expect positive signals on rate cuts, boosting crypto. The global crypto market cap increased by 1% to $2.17 trillion. Jafer also touched on the broader implications of this rivalry for the crypto market as a whole. He predicted that the competition between Solana and Ethereum would drive innovation, benefiting the entire blockchain space. "Healthy competition often leads to better products and services Cryptocurrencies saw notable declines, with Bitcoin dropping by 2.3% and Ethereum falling by 2.8%, ahead of key U.S. economic data. Anticipated policy moves and labor data revisions could influence market directions. Experts suggested potential rallies for Bitcoin if jobless claims decrease, while other major cryptocurrencies like BNB and Solana also faced downturns. On Tuesday, Bitcoin and Ether prices surged up to 4% amid hopes for rate cuts from the Federal Reserve. Investors eagerly awaited insights from the Fed's July meeting minutes and Jerome Powell’s speech at the Jackson Hole Symposium. Mandiant Solutions, a Google subsidiary and cybersecurity expert, confirmed that cryptocurrency exchange WazirX's laptops were secure amidst a cyberattack that stole over $230 million. Investigations to recover assets and identify culprits continue. On Monday, Bitcoin fell 1.6% to $58,652, whereas Ethereum gained 0.5% to $2,620. Market experts mentioned uncertainty and selling pressure affecting Bitcoin's performance. Bitcoin remained within the $58,000 to $59,000 range amid significant economic data and geopolitical tensions. Investors monitored Consumer Price Index figures, retail earnings, and geopolitics. Key support for Bitcoin was $56,300, with resistance at $58,660. Ethereum faced challenges above $2,400. Goldman Sachs purchased $418 million in Bitcoin ETFs, highlighting increasing institutional adoption. Cryptocurrency prices showed mixed trends today, with Bitcoin, Ethereum, BNB, Solana, and XRP trading slightly higher, while Toncoin, Dogecoin, Avalanche, Shiba Inu, and Polkadot traded marginally lower. In a recent ETMarkets live stream, crypto trader Saketh discussed strategies for managing crypto market volatility. Key points included diversification, using stop-loss orders, and leveraging technical analysis. Emphasizing a long-term investment perspective, the session aimed to educate viewers on navigating the risks associated with the unpredictable crypto market. Initially launched as a project by Telegram in 2017, The Open Network (TON) has grown into a significant blockchain ecosystem. Following its separation from Telegram, the project was rebranded and has since set its sights on transforming the digital landscape, with the goal of creating a universal app similar to WeChat by 2028. The project's ambitious vision is outlined in its white paper, released on July 26, 2021. Hedge funds, pensions, and banks invested significantly in Bitcoin-focused ETFs as the asset gained mainstream acceptance with the help of US regulators. Major players like Millennium Management and other firms from around the world engaged. The funds experienced a net inflow of $17 billion this year, bolstered by BlackRock's $20 billion IBIT. WazirX announced on Wednesday that it is ending its custody arrangement with Liminal Custody following a major hack that resulted in the theft of Rs 2,000 crore ($230 million) from its multisig wallet.  Bitcoin and Ethereum traded higher on Tuesday, ahead of key U.S. economic data releases that could influence the Federal Reserve's policy decisions. Ethereum, currently priced at $2,679.08 USD, has experienced considerable price fluctuations. Analysis indicates short-term stability and long-term growth potential. With price targets between $3,500 to $35,000 by 2030, the future of Ethereum looks promising, driven by expanding use cases and significant adoption. Market trends and technological developments are key factors affecting its future value. The crypto market has had a bearish but sensational start to August, with Bitcoin hovering around $57,000 and altcoins experiencing significant declines. The recent market correction, triggered by macroeconomic and inflation-related fears, has presented an opportunity for investors to accumulate promising crypto assets at attractive prices. Since Bitcoin was released, it has grown rapidly to become the top new asset class in the world. While world governments did not perceive it as a financial changemaker asset at first, the significant adoption rates globally have forced them to think otherwise During an ETMarkets live stream, experienced crypto trader Saketh detailed strategies for managing the volatile cryptocurrency market. He emphasized technical analysis and liquidity considerations, distinguishing genuine recoveries from temporary rebounds. Saketh's approach involves strategic trade placement and adjustments based on market trends. Traders were advised to stay cautious and adaptable. Title: These 5 bank stocks can give 26-56% returns in 1 year, according to analysts
Article Content:
In sectors like banking when a regulatory rejig takes place, every player has to follow a new set of rules. It is not possible for any entity to escape the regulatory regime. This leads to a situation where entities which are large or are already following best practices are able to make transition to a new regime in a short span of time and are the first one to get rewarded on the street. Others who take time to the follow which normally are smaller or mid sized players tend to get attention later. There is a set of quasi private sector banks which have taken time to change but now that they have changed it is getting reflected in their numbers. Title: Suitable stocks: A set of stocks that suit both traders and investors and our inherent bullish nature
Article Content:
The majority of retail traders and investors have a bullish bias in stock markets. There is a good enough reason why this bullish bias got developed. First is that our market ecosystem is built in a manner that it pushes you to be bullish. Right from buy and hold concept and the fact that over the years, bullish bias has been rewarded are few of them. But markets see different phases, ranging from bullish, bearish, high volatility with bearish bias. So what about finding a set of stocks, which have higher probability of meeting criteria which suits the underlying bias of the large majority of investors which is “buy and hold” but with an additional probability that majority of these stocks should give return after witnessing all the volatility which is bound to happen in the market. Title: Own midcaps? Do a check & balance exercise as volatility may spike: 4 midcaps from different sectors for long-term investors
Article Content:
Every now and then the market goes through phases, where it prefers a certain set of stocks, not based on sector but based on the overall market cap. So, sometimes it is large caps, at other mid-caps. Now this partially happens, due to the flows which are coming to markets. For example, if more flows are coming to mid-cap or multicap schemes there is bound to be out performance in the mid-cap space. When flows for large caps would increase as has been the case in the month of August. they performed better. Now what it does is that it tends to create a sudden surge in mid-cap or the large cap. Similarly when there is an outflow like the kind of one which we saw in March 2024, midcap stocks tend to decline sharply. Essentially, it is the flows which impact the broader matrix of how midcaps behave. Gift A Story Share member-only stories with your friends or family and help them read it for free. Title: Politics
Article Content: Modi 3.0 has completed its first 100 days, achieving several targets set by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The government has cleared projects worth Rs 3 lakh crore, focusing on infrastructure and farming. Initiatives for youth employment, women empowerment, and tribal development have been launched. Efforts in healthcare, security, and cybercrime mitigation have also been highlighted. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has accused the JMM-led coalition in Jharkhand of supporting Bangladeshi and Rohingya infiltrators for vote bank politics. He claims these infiltrators are altering the demography of Santhal Parganas and Kolhan regions, causing a decline in the tribal population. Modi also criticized the JMM, RJD, and Congress for corruption and vowed that BJP will investigate deaths during excise constable recruitment if elected. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday accused the ruling JMM-led coalition in Jharkhand of patronising Bangladeshi and Rohingya infiltration for vote bank politics. He said infiltrators from the neighbouring country are a major threat to Jharkhand as they are changing the demography of the Santhal Parganas and Kolhan regions of the state. Modi 3.0 has completed its first 100 days, achieving several targets set by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The government has cleared projects worth Rs 3 lakh crore, focusing on infrastructure and farming. Initiatives for youth employment, women empowerment, and tribal development have been launched. Efforts in healthcare, security, and cybercrime mitigation have also been highlighted. Arvind Kejriwal announced his resignation as Delhi's Chief Minister, to be effective in two days. He plans to stay out of office until the upcoming elections, urging voters to support him if they believe in his honesty. The Election Commission's decision on early polls remains uncertain. Bengaluru, September 15 (ANI):  In a major breach of security, an unknown individual rushed toward K’taka CM Siddaramaiah in the middle of his programme. The police quickly responded to evade the man as the incident left CM Siddaramaiah completely startled. However, no official statements have been received from the police yet. An investigation into the matter is underway and more details will follow.   Prime Minister Narendra Modi has accused the JMM-led coalition in Jharkhand of supporting Bangladeshi and Rohingya infiltrators for vote bank politics. He claims these infiltrators are altering the demography of Santhal Parganas and Kolhan regions, causing a decline in the tribal population. Modi also criticized the JMM, RJD, and Congress for corruption and vowed that BJP will investigate deaths during excise constable recruitment if elected. Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara confirmed the arrest of BJP MLA N Munirathna, who faces charges including issuing death threats to a BBMP contractor. The arrest follows complaints of harassment, casteist slurs, and criminal intimidation. Munirathna denies the allegations, calling them a conspiracy. The state BJP has issued a show cause notice demanding his clarification within five days. In a surprising move on Sunday, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced he will resign in two days, following his recent bail in a corruption case related to Delhi's scrapped liquor policy. Kejriwal stated he will only return to the Chief Minister's role if the public gives him a "certificate of honesty" through their vote, and he is advocating for early elections in Delhi, aligning them with those in Maharashtra. The Supreme Court's bail conditions include barring him from entering the Chief Minister's office or signing official documents, which BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla criticized as leaving Kejriwal with a largely ceremonial role. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's resignation announcement has been criticised by BJP leaders, calling it a political maneuver to gain sympathy. Kejriwal stated he would resign in two days and not return as CM until the public declares him honest. AAP supports his decision, emphasising his commitment to honesty and transparency. Launching a scathing attack on the BJP-led Centre, Delhi Chief Minister and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Sunday that even Britishers wouldn't have thought that after 75 years of independence, there would come a ruler more cruel than them. Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday announced that he will resign from his post as the Chief Minister of Delhi after 2 days and will only come back after winning people's trust. The Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor also demanded early elections in the capital. "(The Supreme) Court has done what it could by ruling in my favour and granting me bail. Today, I come to the people's court to ask you whether you consider Kejriwal guilty or honest. In two days, I will resign from the CM's position, and I won’t sit in that chair until the people decide," he said while addressing his party workers in Delhi. Arvind Kejriwal said he wants to give 'agnipariksha' after coming out of jail. Kejriwal also demanded for early elections in Delhi. "Delhi elections due in February but I demand elections in the national capital be held in November with Maharashtra," he said.
